result.execSummary:
The defendant Darnell L Finch was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes: Pay all mandatory court costs, fees, and surcharges: DNA & DV surcharges from CASH BAIL ON DEPOSIT, balance due 1 year from today's date, failure to pay results in a civil judgment. Court waived all Non-mandatory courr costs.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Darnell L Finch

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Sentencing Proceeded.  Statements by parties and defendant.
AS TO COUNT 1
The court sentenced the defendant to 3 DAYS in the House of Correction, with credit for 3 DAYS time served, this is a TIME SERVED DISPOSISTION. Pay all MANDATORY court costs, fees, and surcharges: DNA & DV surcharges from bail on deposit, balance due 1 year from today's date, failure to pay results in a civil judgment. Court WAIVED all NON-Mandatory Court advised defendant of right to seek post conviction relief.

Filed: 
-Pretrial Sentence Credit
-Notice of Right to Seek Post-Conviction Relief

Defendant Darnell L Finch in court with attorney Michael B Plaisted.  Owen M. Piotrowski appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Parties have reached a resolution in this matter. 
AS TO COUNT 1
Defendant changes plea(s) to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to plea, advised of Constitutional Rights and the maximum penalties. Court found that the defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived rights.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights form, received and filed. Parties stipulate to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea(s).  Court found defendant GUILTY and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.

Court set bail at $50.00 cash. $50.00 transferred from 14CM368.   Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY to be monitored by drug testing and portable breathalyzers.    No use or possession of illegal or controlled substances without a valid prescription. Court ordered no firearms.
Case set with case 14CM368, which was set for Jury Trial. Defense requests a Plea and Sentencing date. Court ordered bail from 14CM368 transferred to this case. Case adjourned to branch 23.

Defendant Darnell L Finch in court with attorney Michael B Plaisted.  Sarra Mae Kiaie appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant appeared for court. Court held colloquy with defendant about late appearance. Court vacated warrant.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for March 19, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Attorney Michael B Plaisted in court.  Sarra Mae Kiaie appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered a Bench Warrant to be issued.  COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE COMMISSIONER ON RETURN OF THE BENCH  WARRANT. Court ordered bail forfeited pending restitution and recompense.
Received and Filed, Justice Point Report.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION INCLUDING DRUG TESTING.
Defendant advised if released from custody it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.
Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping, a warrant issued or high cash bail.

Defendant Darnell L Finch in court with attorney Brian C. Hagner.  
Defendant Darnell L Finch in custody.  
William T. Berens appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  

Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Grady, Branch 23 due to lower pending case 14CM368.  
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  
Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  
DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Status conference scheduled for February 11, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
Arrest Warrant received from the D.A.'s office on filing date of Criminal Complaint.
